verses.verse: Behold, <S%H2009><s%> you are fair, <S%H3302><s%> my love; <S%H7474><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> you are fair; <S%H3302><s%> you have doves' <S%H3123><s%> eyes <S%H5869><s%> within <S%H1157><s%> your locks: <S%H6777><s%> your hair <S%H8181><s%> is as a flock <S%H5739><s%> of goats, <S%H5795><s%> that appear <S%H1570><s%> from mount <S%H2022><s%> Gilead. <S%H1568><s%>

Your teeth <S%H8127><s%> are like a flock <S%H5739><s%> of sheep that are even shorn, <S%H7094><s%> which came <S%H5927><s%> up from the washing; <S%H7367><s%> whereof every <S%H3605><s%> one bear <S%H8382><s%> twins, <S%H8382><s%> and none <S%H369><s%> is barren <S%H7909><s%> among them.

Your lips <S%H8193><s%> are like a thread <S%H2339><s%> of scarlet, <S%H8144><s%> and your speech <S%H4057><s%> is comely: <S%H5000><s%> your temples <S%H7541><s%> are like a piece <S%H6400><s%> of a pomegranate <S%H7416><s%> within <S%H1157><s%> your locks. <S%H6777><s%>

Your neck <S%H6677><s%> is like the tower <S%H4026><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%> built <S%H1129><s%> for an armory, <S%H8530><s%> where on <S%H5921><s%> there hang <S%H8518><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> bucklers, <S%H4043><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> shields <S%H7982><s%> of mighty <S%H1368><s%> men.
Your two <S%H8147><s%> breasts <S%H7699><s%> are like two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H6082><s%> roes <S%H6646><s%> that are twins, <S%H8380><s%> which feed <S%H7462><s%> among the lilies. <S%H7799><s%>

Until <S%H5704><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> break, <S%H6315><s%> and the shadows <S%H6752><s%> flee <S%H5127><s%> away, I will get <S%H3212><s%> me to the mountain <S%H2022><s%> of myrrh, <S%H4753><s%> and to the hill <S%H1389><s%> of frankincense. <S%H3828><s%>
You are all <S%H3605><s%> fair, <S%H3302><s%> my love; <S%H7474><s%> there is no <S%H369><s%> spot <S%H3971><s%> in you.

Come <S%H935><s%> with me from Lebanon, <S%H3844><s%> my spouse, <S%H3618><s%> with me from Lebanon: <S%H3844><s%> look <S%H7789><s%> from the top <S%H7218><s%> of Amana, <S%H549><s%> from the top <S%H7218><s%> of Shenir <S%H8149><s%> and Hermon, <S%H2768><s%> from the lions' <S%H738><s%> dens, <S%H4585><s%> from the mountains <S%H2042><s%> of the leopards. <S%H5246><s%>

You have ravished <S%H3823><s%> my heart, <S%H3823><s%> my sister, <S%H269><s%> my spouse; <S%H3618><s%> you have ravished <S%H3823><s%> my heart <S%H3823><s%> with one <S%H259><s%> of your eyes, <S%H5869><s%> with one <S%H259><s%> chain <S%H6060><s%> of your neck. <S%H6677><s%>

How <S%H4100><s%> fair <S%H3302><s%> is your love, <S%H1730><s%> my sister, <S%H269><s%> my spouse! <S%H3618><s%> how <S%H4100><s%> much better <S%H2896><s%> is your love <S%H1730><s%> than wine! <S%H3196><s%> and the smell <S%H7381><s%> of your ointments <S%H8081><s%> than all <S%H3605><s%> spices! <S%H1314><s%>

Your lips, <S%H8193><s%> O my spouse, <S%H3618><s%> drop <S%H5197><s%> as the honeycomb: <S%H5317><s%> honey <S%H1706><s%> and milk <S%H2461><s%> are under <S%H8478><s%> your tongue; <S%H3956><s%> and the smell <S%H7381><s%> of your garments <S%H8008><s%> is like the smell <S%H7381><s%> of Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%>
A garden <S%H1588><s%> enclosed <S%H5274><s%> is my sister, <S%H269><s%> my spouse; <S%H3618><s%> a spring <S%H1530><s%> shut <S%H5274><s%> up, a fountain <S%H4599><s%> sealed. <S%H2856><s%>
Your plants <S%H7973><s%> are an orchard <S%H6508><s%> of pomegranates, <S%H7416><s%> with pleasant <S%H4022><s%> fruits; <S%H6529><s%> camphire, <S%H3724><s%> with spikenard, <S%H5373><s%>

Spikenard <S%H5373><s%> and saffron; <S%H3750><s%> calamus <S%H7070><s%> and cinnamon, <S%H7076><s%> with all <S%H3605><s%> trees <S%H6086><s%> of frankincense; <S%H3828><s%> myrrh <S%H4753><s%> and aloes, <S%H174><s%> with all <S%H3605><s%> the chief <S%H7218><s%> spices: <S%H1314><s%>
A fountain <S%H4599><s%> of gardens, <S%H1588><s%> a well <S%H875><s%> of living <S%H2416><s%> waters, <S%H4325><s%> and streams <S%H5140><s%> from Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%>

Awake, <S%H5782><s%> O north <S%H6828><s%> wind; and come, <S%H935><s%> you south; <S%H8486><s%> blow <S%H6315><s%> on my garden, <S%H1588><s%> that the spices <S%H1314><s%> thereof may flow <S%H5140><s%> out. Let my beloved <S%H1730><s%> come <S%H935><s%> into his garden, <S%H1588><s%> and eat <S%H398><s%> his pleasant <S%H4022><s%> fruits. <S%H6529><s%>
